intro: Decaisnina sumbawensis, commonly known as the Sumbawa lily, is a flowering plant native to the island of Sumbawa in Indonesia. It belongs to the family Alstroemeriaceae and is characterized by its striking, large, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and white. The plant features a short, stout stem with broad, strap-like leaves that are often arranged in a rosette pattern. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in montane forests. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and valuable species in botanical collections.
